title: Job Openings at Fine Brothers Limited
content:
Fine Brothers Limited is the consumers’ first choice source for Mobile Phones, Tablet PCs, Laptops, Quality Electronics and Inverter /Solar Power Systems and accessories. Fine Brothers Limited takes the lead in customer service innovations. All sales are supported with after-sales support; Warranty, Repairs and Services.

We provide quality products and services throughout our outlets across Nigeria. We have gone beyond the shores of Enugu with Sales outlets across Nigeria. The company have displayed a long track of integrity, customer satisfaction and Professionalism. We offer an exciting and challenging work environment for individuals to reach their career goals.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



1.) Account Assistant

Job Location: Okpara Avenue, Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Responsibilities


	Creating and processing invoices.
	Cross-checking invoices with payments and expenses to ensure accuracy.
	Managing a company's accounts payable and receivable.
	Sending bills and invoices to clients.
	Tracking organization expenses.
	Processing refunds.
	Reconciling financial accounts.
	Cash Allocation.
	Sales order processing.
	Managing daily posts in and out.
	Handling and writing cheques.
	Receiving and processing all invoice expense forms and request for payment.
	Verifying calculations working with the accounting system.
	Managing petty cash transactions.
	Controlling credit and ensuring debtors pay on time.
	Reconciliation of direct debits and financial accounts.
	Ensuring all payment amounts and records are accurate.
	Preparation of statutory accounts.
	Working with journals, sales, and purchase ledgers.
	Planning and budgeting control.
	Assisting the accountant with audits.
	Preparation of financial reports.
	Any other responsibility as may be assigned by the accountant, management and/or directors from time to time.


Qualifications


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accountancy.
	Basic understanding of accounting principles and financial reporting.
	Proficiency in MS Office, especially Excel; familiarity with accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, SAP) is a plus.
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
	Ability to work collaboratively and communicate effectively with team members.
	Willingness to learn and adapt to changing tasks and responsibilities.
	1-5 years of accounting experience.


Application Closing Date: 3rd November, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and credentials to: judithi@finebrothers.com.ng using "Account Assistant" as the subject of the mail.

 

 

2.) Company Driver

Job Location: Enugu
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Assisting with the loading and unloading of company’s merchandize to ensure they are handled carefully to prevent damage.
	Performing routine checks on the vehicle, such as monitoring fuel levels, tire pressure, and fluid levels, and ensuring the vehicle is clean and in good working condition. Reporting any issues or required repairs.
	Adhering to all traffic laws and company policies while discharging duties.
	Ensuring the safety and protection of merchandize and staff entrusted by driving carefully to avoid accidents and vehicle damage. Plan and ply the most efficient and secured routes for making delivery.
	Ensure timely conveyance of company’s goods, and as well ensure to properly lock the vehicle when not in use.
	Recognize and report any accident, injury, damage of company’s vehicle, electrical, mechanical and other faults as identified to the management.
	Ensure to acquire all legal documentations associated to the execution of your daily duties such as drivers license, etc.
	Ensure that assigned vehicle is used for authorized assignments and is in good working condition.
	Periodic checks on vehicle papers and ensuring they are up-to-date.
	Perform all other duties as may be specified and assigned by the management.


Requirements


	Must have experience in driving manual and automatic vehicles.
	Should possess a valid drivers’ license.
	Have extensive driving experience.
	Must be 40 years and ABOVE.
	(A married family man with above requirement is an added advantage).


Salary


	Very attractive.


Application Closing Date: 2nd November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and valid driver's license to: ngozichukwua@finebrothers.com.ng using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquiries, call 08118902773, 08142783434.

 

 

3.) Retail Sales Representative

Job Locations: Abuja (FCT), Aba - Abia, Owerri - Imo, Benin - Edo, Enugu, Port Harcourt - Rivers, Onitsha - Anambra, Ikeja - Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Present, promote and sell products/services using solid arguments to existing and prospective customers
	Perform cost-­benefit and needs analysis of existing/potential customers to meet their needs
	Establish, develop and maintain positive business and customer relationships
	Reach out to customer leads through cold calling
	Expedite the resolution of customer problems and complaints to maximize satisfaction
	Achieve agreed upon sales targets and outcomes within schedule
	Coordinate sales effort with team members and other departments
	Analyze the territory/market’s potential, track sales and status reports
	Supply management with reports on customer needs, problems, interests, competitive activities, and potential for new products and services.
	Keep abreast of best practices and promotional trends
	Continuously improve through feedback.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Marketing, or a related field.
	1 - 5 years of proven work experience as a Sales Representative
	Excellent knowledge of MS Office
	Highly motivated and target driven with a proven track record in sales
	Excellent selling, negotiation and communication skills
	Prioritizing, time management and organizational skills
	Ability to create and deliver presentations tailored to the audience needs
	Relationship management skills and openness to feedback.


Application Closing Date: 3rd November, 2025.

Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Credentials to: ngozichukwua@finebrothers.com.ng using the Job Position and Location as the subject of the mail.

Note: For more enquiries, call 08118902773, 08142783434.

Female Video Creator Job at Addandview




        
    

        
        Addandview is a startup business hub that empowers startups and businesses to thrive through personalized partnerships, mentorship, insights, and services. We are fully remote and collaborate using WhatsApp, Google Meet, Email, and Telegram.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Female Video Creator
Job Location: Port Harcourt, Rivers (Remote)
Employment Type: Full-time

About the Role
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	‎We’re looking for a dedicated and talented Female Video Creator to take full ownership of all video-related projects at Addandview.
	This is a key full-time role where your creativity and skills will directly shape the visual and brand identity of Addandview and our partner startups.


Responsibilities‎
‎Your work will include:


	‎Being the focal point and producer of all Addandview videos.
	‎Producing YouTube videos for our channel.
	‎Creating engaging short-form videos for social media (Instagram, TikTok, Facebook, LinkedIn, etc.).
	‎Developing promotional and marketing videos for startups under our personalized partnerships
	‎Transform ideas or rough drafts into polished, professional videos.
	‎Edit videos using Canva, CapCut, or other professional tools.
	‎Ensure consistent quality and meet deadlines.
	‎Collaborate with team members, admins, and other departments.
	‎Stay up to date with video content and social media trends.


‎ Requirements


	‎ Female applicants only.
	‎ 1–2 years of experience in video creation/editing.
	‎ Proficiency in Canva, CapCut, or similar tools.
	‎ Strong creativity and ability to turn concepts into engaging videos.
	‎ Reliable, detail-oriented, and deadline-focused.
	‎ Able to work full-time, remotely.
	‎ Comfortable using WhatsApp, Google Meet, Email, and Telegram as work tools.


Remuneration


	Salary: N50,000 - N150,000 Monthly (based on experience & performance).
	This is a starting salary for our growing startup, with room for growth as Addandview expands and based on performance.
	Extra bonus opportunities tied to video quality, deadlines, and creativity.


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, portfolio and a Cover Letter to: addandviewcareers@gmail.com using "Application – Female Video Creator – [Your Full Name]" as the subject of the mail.

Note


	‎ Fully Remote – work from anywhere in Nigeria.
	‎ Be part of a growing startup journey, with real opportunities to expand your role and earnings.
